title: HEX011 | Learn to Breathe
artist: Tim Tama, Paolo Ferrara, Lorenzo Raganzini
about:
"Learn to Breathe" Ep
Tim Tama
remix: Paolo Ferrara & Lorenzo Raganzini
style: Techno

🔴 VINYL PRE-ORDER (Jan/Feb 2023)
DIGITAL AVAILABLE NOW

It's with pleasure that we welcome back Tim Tama at HEX Recordings, this time with a full EP by himself and a remix from the HEX founders Paolo Ferrara and Lorenzo Raganzini. 

In this release you will discover a new, dark and hidden, side of the dutch producer where he fuses for the first time distorsion and guitars with his signature sound of dreamy and ethereal melodies.

The release is available in the Limited edition "supernova" vinyl (only 300 pieces) and in Digital format.
The vinyl is a pre-order with delivery date in January/February 2023.

Support the Techno scene and keep alive the slow and manual vinyl-pressing Art process.

Tracklist:
A1 - No One Will Help You
A2 - Learn To Breathe
B1 - Monomer
B2 - Angst
B3 - Learn To Breathe (Paolo Ferrara & Lorenzo Raganzini remix)

packages.description:
Limited 12" Vinyl
(only 300 copies)

Pre-order, delivery on Jan/Feb 2023

title: Pulse Flow
about:
Hot off his release for Truncate’s label, Enemy Records welcomes Kai van Dongen with Pulse Flow, a diverse 4-track EP that offers something special for each part of the night. We hope you like rollers, because that’s what you’re gonna get!

“Pulse Flow” kicks off with PseudoRhythm, the take-no-prisoners peak-time cut of the EP. The 90s-indebted track is as groovy as it is punishing. It goes “wa wa wa, we we we” so you know it’s good.

13:16 takes the EP into deeper territory with heaving bass and pulsating polymeter synths. By the time the pad kicks in, it proves itself essential for any DJ into the marathon journey vibes. Down the Middle brings the EP back up for some air…tinged with feel-good vibes and mood-setting minimalistic synth work. It’s perfect for anybody who wants to let it ride or layer it until their heart’s content. 

Beachside Flow caps off the EP with throbbing bass, pedaling percussion, and tripped out synth work. The track evolves continuously and smoothly, keeping dancers sucked in. On Pulse Flow, Kai demonstrates that techno is best in its simplest form.

title: BREAK A FANCY VASE
about:
Dustin Zahn’s Enemy Records returns with four raw and relentless Techno cuts from Marcal, VIL, Bidoben, and Nastia Reigel. On this rare occurrence, Enemy sets aside the deep psychedelia in favor of unapologetic party tracks. It’s a perfect soundtrack for very messy nights.

On “Break a Fancy Vase,” Enemy welcomes back Marcal after his recent “Thought Control” EP for the particularly slamming “Never Wrote This.” Nastia Reigel is finally back on the label for the first time in a couple years with the equally spooky and trippy “Not Int.”

Joining the resistance for their first time is VIL and Bidoben. VIL’s “Miles” cut has made its way into Zahn’s sets for a while now and it’s here in its final form. Bidoben is fresh off his latest Truncate EP with “L'Ère du Fragment,” a track brimming with attitude.

title: Jungle House
about:
Soundcloud Previews: https://soundcloud.com/dustin-zahn/enemy038

After his recent remix of Dustin Zahn’s ‘Submit Yourself,’ Rene Wise returns to Enemy Records with his own EP, “Jungle House.” All 5 tracks are perfectly in line with Wise’s signature grooves while delivering different moods suited for each part of the night.

“Jungle House” is an EP that has been teased by a few select taste-making DJs in their sets over the past year. Pandemic delays be damned, the record has finally arrived!

Screeching kicks things off with a heavy bleep-focused hook that slowly evolves over the track while remaining focused and restrained. It’s a perfect balance of old school Techno influence with new school nuances and sensibilities. Jungle House flips the script with saturated jacking drums and hypnotic vocals. It’s the ideal track for injecting some funk into the mix while keeping things deep and rolling.

Cosmo drops the heads-down business and goes straight for the jugular. It’s full of peak-time energy thanks to a pulsating, percussive workout that constantly modulates and locks the user into the groove. Gummy closes out the 12” with an extremely hypnotic and trippy vibe that might have you wondering what the hell is going in that jungle at night.

Lastly, Dogs completes the digital EP and the title does exactly what it says. If you like dogs, this one's for you. If you’ve ever been attacked by dogs then...well...this is awkward.
credits:
Written & Produced by: Rene Wise 
Mastered by: Glowcast
Art Design by: Vanessa Vargas 
Distributed by: N.E.W.S.

title: Thought Control
about:
Enemy Records welcomes Brazilian-born Marcal with his infectious new single, “Thought Control.” Every track is composed of chugging, groovy, and hypnotic techno that is perfect for any occasion. “There is much sadness in the world, but not tonight.”

“Thought Control” takes on a slightly deeper and heady direction than his previous output for Rekids or Uncage. However, the drums are still slammin’ and every detail is crystal-clear. Marcal’s natural progression shows he is more in control of his sound than ever before.

Manta Ray starts the EP with swinging drums and shots in the dark that will keep people marching through the night. Nevoa is the most melodic cut on the record. It’s moody, wandering, and tripped out enough to disassociate you from reality. Robotic Thinking is as rigged as it is funky. The strong, pedaling, unified groove is laced with vowel formants and pulsing sinewaves. Closing out the EP is Seroto, a steady heads-down tribal workout for those trying to find their way through the late-night fog.
credits:
Written & Produced by: Laerte Marçal
Art Design by: Ryote
Distributed by: N.E.W.S.

title: Ecclesia
about:
For “Ecclesia,” Enemy Records calls upon Rove Ranger’s “HISS” alias for a deeper and more psychedelic take on his usual peak-time sound. The result is six slabs of Techno hypnotism designed for marathon sets in concrete halls.

Every track is fully indebted to the resurgence of stripped down minimalist 90s techno, further accented by HISS’s signature grooves and production skills. Like most Enemy releases, Ecclesia shines late at night when only the true heads and the real freaks remain.

Photography by: Annabel Christmann (IG @roystiger)

title: Petra 02 (Dax J Remix) EP
about: Electronic pioneer, Christopher Just’s initial music came out in 1993 under his own name and various pseudonyms, like “DJ One finger” and “ilsa Gold”. The “Petra” project was originally released in 1996 showcasing the ferocious sound of 90’s analog hardware. Over 25 years later Dax J presents his colossal remix of the relativity unknown and now unearthed gem that went under the radar for so many years. The B - side of the record comes with a signature Dax J deep percussive groove, “The Train”

packages.type_title: PRE-ORDER [February Shipping] - Petra 02 (Dax J Remix) 12" Vinyl
packages.description:
***PRE-ORDER [February Shipping]***

12" vinyl + A5 photo card insert + protective plastic sleeve.

-------- PLEASE NOTE ---------
To ensure the fastest and safest delivery we use recorded delivery with UPS. They require a phone number, so please leave a contact phone number that we will pass on to UPS and they will give you an exact delivery time slot. If we don't see a phone number we will try to contact you for one, if we don't manage to get in touch with you after a few days we will ship out via normal delivery. Thank you.
